  • 2 cups all-purpose flour, sifted
  • 1 Â¾ cups granulated sugar
  • Â¾ cup unsweetened cocoa powder
  • 1 Â½ teaspoons baking powder
  • 1 Â½ teaspoons baking soda
  • 1 teaspoon salt
  • 2 large eggs
  • 1 cup whole milk
  • Â½ cup vegetable oil
  • 2 teaspoons vanilla extract
  • 1 cup boiling water
  • 1 cup chocolate ganache for filling

ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ³ Instructions

  1. Preheat your oven to 350Â°F (175Â°C) and grease two round cake pans. In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, sugar, cocoa powder, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. Whisk until well blended.
  2. Add the eggs, milk, vegetable oil, and vanilla extract to the dry ingredients. Mix on medium speed for about 2 minutes until smooth. Carefully stir in the boiling water until the batter is well combined; it will be thin.
  3. Pour the batter evenly into the prepared pans and bake for 30-35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Allow the cakes to cool in the pans for 10 minutes before transferring them to wire racks to cool completely.
  4. Once cooled, slice the top off each cake layer to create a flat surface. Place one layer on a serving plate and spread a generous amount of chocolate ganache on top. Place the second layer on top and press gently.
  5. Cover the entire cake with a layer of buttercream frosting, smoothing it out with a spatula. Use colorful fondant to create playful decorations, shaping them into fun rat features.
  6. Serve the cake at room temperature and enjoy the delightful surprise inside!

  1. Begin by placing the peeled and cubed Yukon gold potatoes in a large pot. Cover them with cold water and add a pinch of salt. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat.

  3. While the potatoes cook, melt the butter in a small saucepan over low heat. Add the minced garlic and sautÃ© for 1-2 minutes until fragrant, being careful not to brown it.
  4. Drain the cooked potatoes and return them to the pot. Begin mashing them with a potato masher or ricer until smooth.
  5. Pour in the warmed heavy cream and melted garlic butter, mixing until fully incorporated. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
  6. Transfer the creamy mashed potatoes to a serving bowl and garnish with chopped chives before serving.

item.description: Savor the rich flavors of this decadent chocolate Yule log, a showstopper for any festive gathering! With a moist chocolate sponge and creamy filling, itâ€™s perfect for holiday celebrations. Impress your guests with this classic dessert thatâ€™s sure to delight. Pin this recipe for your next celebration! | â±ï¸ Prep: 30min | Cook: 25min | Serves: 8 | #cat1761230294638 #Mediumrecipe #1hourmeals #recipe #cooking

item.content:encoded:
â±ï¸ Prep Time: 30 minutes

ğŸ³ Cook Time: 25 minutes

â° Total Time: N/A minutes

ğŸ½ï¸ Servings: 8

ğŸ“Š Difficulty: Medium

ğŸ¥˜ Ingredients

  • 4 large eggs, separated
  • 1 cup granulated sugar
  • 1/2 cup all-purpose flour, sifted
  • 1/3 cup unsweetened cocoa powder
  • 1/4 teaspoon salt
  • 1/2 teaspoon baking powder
  • 1 cup heavy cream
  • 1/2 cup powdered sugar
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
  • Chocolate shavings for garnish

ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ³ Instructions

  1. Preheat your oven to 350Â°F (175Â°C) and line a 15x10-inch jelly roll pan with parchment paper, ensuring it extends over the edges.
  2. In a large bowl, beat the egg yolks and granulated sugar until the mixture is pale and thick. Gradually fold in the sifted flour, cocoa powder, salt, and baking powder until just combined.
  3. In a separate bowl, whip the egg whites until stiff peaks form, then gently fold them into the chocolate mixture to maintain the airy texture.
  4. Spread the batter evenly in the prepared pan and bake for 20-25 minutes, or until the cake springs back when lightly touched.
  5. Once baked, remove from the oven and let it cool in the pan for 5 minutes before inverting onto a clean kitchen towel dusted with powdered sugar. Carefully peel off the parchment paper.
  6. While the cake cools, whip the heavy cream with powdered sugar and vanilla until soft peaks form. Spread the whipped cream over the cooled cake, then roll it up tightly from one short end, using the towel to assist. Chill for 30 minutes before serving.

item.title: Comforting Beef Stew for Chilly Nights
item.description: Indulge in this comforting beef stew that warms the soul! Packed with tender beef, vibrant vegetables, and fragrant herbs, it's perfect for family dinners or gatherings. Enjoy this hearty dish on chilly nights and make it a staple in your kitchen. Pin this recipe for your next cozy meal! | â±ï¸ Prep: 15min | Cook: 120min | Serves: 6 | #Easyrecipe #recipe #cooking #foodie #homemade
item.dc:creator: author_001
item.content:encoded:
â±ï¸ Prep Time: 15 minutes

ğŸ³ Cook Time: 120 minutes

â° Total Time: N/A minutes

ğŸ½ï¸ Servings: 6

ğŸ“Š Difficulty: Easy

ğŸ¥˜ Ingredients

  • 2 pounds beef chuck, cut into 1-inch cubes
  • 4 cups beef broth
  • 3 medium carrots, sliced
  • 2 large potatoes, diced
  • 1 onion, chopped
  • 3 cloves garlic, minced
  • 2 tablespoons tomato paste
  • 1 teaspoon dried thyme
  • 1 bay leaf
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • 2 tablespoons olive oil

ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ³ Instructions

  1. In a large pot, heat the olive oil over medium-high heat. Add the beef cubes and sear them until browned on all sides, about 5-7 minutes.
  2. Remove the beef from the pot and set aside. In the same pot, add the chopped onion and garlic, sautÃ©ing until softened and fragrant, about 3-4 minutes.
  3. Stir in the tomato paste, thyme, and bay leaf, cooking for another minute to enhance the flavors.
  4. Return the beef to the pot and pour in the beef broth. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and cover, allowing it to simmer for about 1.5 hours.
  5. After 1.5 hours, add the carrots and potatoes to the stew. Continue to simmer for an additional 30 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender.
  6. Season with salt and pepper to taste before serving hot.

ğŸ¥˜ Ingredients

  • 2 Â½ cups all-purpose flour, sifted
  • 2 cups granulated sugar
  • 1 cup unsalted butter, softened
  • 4 large eggs
  • 1 cup whole milk
  • 1 tablespoon vanilla extract
  • 1 tablespoon baking powder
  • Â½ teaspoon salt

ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ³ Instructions

  1. Preheat your oven to 350Â°F (175Â°C) and grease two 9-inch round cake pans. Line the bottoms with parchment paper for easy removal.

item.content:encoded:
â±ï¸ Prep Time: 15 minutes

â° Total Time: N/A minutes

ğŸ¥˜ Ingredients

  • 1/2 cup popcorn kernels, popped
  • 1 cup granulated sugar
  • 1/4 cup unsalted butter
  • 1/4 cup light corn syrup
  • 2 tablespoons gochujang
  • 1/2 teaspoon baking soda
  • 1/4 teaspoon salt
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract

ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ³ Instructions

  1. Begin by popping the popcorn kernels using your preferred method. Once popped, place them in a large mixing bowl and set aside.
  2. In a medium saucepan over medium heat, combine the sugar, butter, corn syrup, and gochujang. Stir continuously until the mixture comes to a boil.
  3. Allow the caramel to boil without stirring for about 4-5 minutes, or until it reaches a golden amber color. Keep a close eye to prevent burning.
  4. Remove the saucepan from heat and quickly stir in the baking soda, salt, and vanilla extract. The mixture will bubble up, so be cautious.
  5. Pour the caramel over the popped popcorn, using a spatula to gently fold and coat the popcorn evenly. Allow it to cool slightly before serving.
